prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
Apologies for the confusion earlier. Here is an updated version of the code:
```
# Import required libraries
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)

# Load gene count file
gene_counts <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
col_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors=FALSE, sep="\t")

# Ensuring that sample names in annotation data and count data are identical
rownames(col_data) <- col_data$diagnosis
colnames(gene_counts) <- c("Genes", rownames(col_data))

# Redefining rownames in count data
rownames(gene_counts) <- gene_counts$Genes
gene_counts <- gene_counts[,-1]

# Checking for duplicate row names and removing them if any
dup <- anyDuplicated(rownames(gene_counts))
if (dup > 0) {
  gene_counts <- gene_counts[-dup, ]
}

# Running DESeq2 
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = gene_counts, colData = col_data, design = ~ group)
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Extracting group specific genes
res <- results(dds)
group_specific_genes <- subset(res, padj < 0.05)

# Performing PCA
pca_data <- prcomp(t(assay(dds)[rownames(group_specific_genes), ]))

# prepare data for ggplot
df <- data.frame(pca_data$x, group = col_data$group)

# generating PCA plot
p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) + 
  geom_point() +
  ggtitle("PCA plot colored by group") +
  xlab("PC1") + 
  ylab("PC2") +
  theme_minimal()

print(p)
```
This updated code makes sure the count data and annotation data have identical sample names, handles duplicate row names, and correctly segments data for DESeq analysis.
